translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Discourse on the Dhamma (the Boat)
Because a person should know the Dhamma,
The gods would worship him like Indra;

translated: He, being worshipped, with a mind full of confidence,ğŸ”½The learned one proclaims the Dhamma.
The wise one, not clinging, reflecting,
Practicing in accordance with the Dhamma;
He becomes discerning, discerning, and skillful,
The one who attends to such a one heedfully.
Attending to the small and foolish,
And to the envious one who has no future goal;
Not discerning the Dhamma right here,
He goes to death with doubts unresolved.
Just as a man, having crossed a river,
The great waters, the water-flow that is swift;
He, being carried along, going with the current,
How could he be able to save others?
